stages.name: Seedling stage
stages.purpose: Remove excess seedlings to allow the remaining plants to grow larger and healthier.

stages.name: Vigorous vegetative stage
stages.purpose: Apply a layer of compost or manure to the soil around the plants to encourage root growth.

stages.name: Tassel initiation stage
stages.purpose: Apply a fertilizer high in nitrogen and phosphorus to promote tassel development.

stages.name: Silking stage
stages.purpose: Water the plants regularly to ensure that the silks are able to absorb moisture.

stages.name: Grain filling stage
stages.purpose: Monitor the plants for pests and diseases and treat any problems as soon as possible.

stages.name: Maturity stage
stages.purpose: Harvest the corn when the kernels are fully ripe.

tips.tip: Use sharp pruning shears or a knife to make clean cuts.
Avoid cutting into the main stem of the plant.
Dispose of prunings properly to prevent the spread of pests and diseases.
Prune in the morning or evening when the weather is cool and dry.
Be careful not to over-prune, as this can stress the plants and reduce yields.
